verses.text: 猶大王亞們的兒子約西亞在位的時候，耶和華的話臨到希西家的玄孫、亞瑪利雅的曾孫、基大利的孫子、古示的兒子西番雅。
verses.heading: Introduction

verses.text: 耶和華說：「我必把萬物從地上完全除滅。」
verses.heading: The Lord’s Day of Judgment is Approaching

verses.text: 耶和華說：「我必除滅人類、牲畜、空中飛鳥、海裡的魚。我必使惡人跌倒，我必把人類從地上剪除。
我必伸手攻擊猶大，攻擊耶路撒冷所有的居民。我必從這地方除掉巴力所餘下的，除掉拜偶像的祭司的名字，以及耶和華的祭司；

words.note: A Canaanite deity

verses.text: 就是那些在房頂上敬拜天上萬象的，那些敬拜耶和華，指著他起誓，又指著瑪勒公起誓的，

words.note: Refers to celestial bodies worshipped as deities.
Ammonite deity, also known as Molech.

verses.text: 那些轉離不跟從耶和華的，不尋找耶和華，也不求問他的。」

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for following God or a teacher.

verses.text: 你要在我主耶和華面前肅靜！因為耶和華的日子臨近了，因為耶和華已經預備了祭物，把自己所請來的人分別為聖。

words.note: Implies solemn silence and respectful awe.
Introduces object of verb, emphasizing action on it.
Indicates the following verb phrase describes the preceding noun.
Lit. 'separate to be holy'.

verses.text: 「到了我耶和華獻祭的日子，我必懲罰首領和王子，懲罰所有穿外族衣服的人。

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to non-Israelite nations.

verses.text: 到那日，我必懲罰所有跳過門檻的，所有使強暴和欺詐充滿主人房屋的。」

words.note: Often refers to a specific, significant day in prophecy.
Refers to those who 'leap over the threshold' in a ritual or superstitious manner.

verses.text: 耶和華說：「到那日，必有呼叫的聲音從魚門發出來，必有哀號從新區發出來，必有崩裂巨響從山間發出來。

words.note: A gate of ancient Jerusalem, mentioned in Nehemiah.
A district in ancient Jerusalem.
Describes a loud, destructive sound of breaking apart.

verses.text: 瑪革提施的居民哪！你們要哀號，因為所有的商人都滅亡了；所有稱銀子的都被剪除了。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from preceding verb-object: 'those who weigh silver'.

verses.text: 那時，我必提燈搜查耶路撒冷，懲罰那些在罪中陶然自得的人（「在罪中陶然自得」直譯是「沉澱在酒渣上」）。這些人心裡說：『耶和華必不賜福，也不降禍。』

words.note: Refers to being comfortably settled, often implying complacency or apathy in a negative context here.

verses.text: 他們的財寶必成為掠物，他們的房屋必變為廢墟。他們建造房屋，卻不得住在其中；他們栽植葡萄園，卻不得喝所出的酒。」

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from following verb, 'that which is...'

verses.text: 耶和華的大日子臨近了，臨近了，來得非常快速。聽！耶和華的日子的聲音。在那日，勇士要哀痛地號叫。

words.note: Links a verb to its adverbial complement.
Links an adjective/noun to form an adverbial phrase, 'sorrowfully'.

verses.text: 那日是忿怒的日子，是困苦艱難的日子，是荒廢淒涼的日子，是黑暗幽冥的日子，是密雲漆黑的日子，
是吹號吶喊，要攻打堅城，進擊城樓的日子。

words.note: Refers to a call to war or assembly in ancient times.
Refers to a strongly defended city.

verses.text: 我要使人受困苦，以致他們像瞎子行走，因為他們得罪耶和華。他們的鮮血必倒出，如倒灰塵一樣，他們的身體必被遺棄像糞土一般。

words.definition: so that, with the result that
words.note: Often used in formal or literary contexts.
Implies incurring guilt or offense, especially against God.
The proper name of God in the Old Testament.
Emphasizes the vividness of the blood.
Refers to something worthless or despised.

verses.text: 在耶和華發怒的日子，他們的金銀也不能救他們，全地都要被他的妒火吞滅；因為他要徹底毀滅地上所有的居民，真是可怕的毀滅。

words.note: The proper name of God in the Old Testament.
Often used to describe God's wrath in the Bible.
Refers to the entire world, often in a spiritual context.
Metaphor for intense, destructive jealousy or wrath.
A strong verb implying complete destruction.
Refers to the surface of the earth, often in contrast to heaven.
